forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Partly sunny. High near 60, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. West wind around 13 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 4am. Partly cloudy, with a low around 48. West northwest wind around 14 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The day in Downtown San Francisco carries a cool, slightly unsettled air, with clouds lingering ominously above. As the afternoon progresses, a gentle pattering of rain may join the mix, but for now, a blend of sun and clouds creates a dimly lit canvas, with high temperatures barely crawling to the low sixties. The signature west wind sweeps through, punctuating the atmosphere with brisk gusts that tease the edges of jackets.

Tonight, the chance of rain remains, teasing the concept of shelter as the temperature dips into the cool forties. Those venturing out are advised to don layers that marry warmth with the ability to breathe in the cooler evening air. A light raincoat might not go amiss, particularly for those daring enough to take a stroll along the waterfront or savor a quiet moment in one of the parks. With this fleeting shift in weather, it’s an ideal evening to seek refuge in a cozy café or a local eatery, enjoying the company of friends or mulling over a good book, as the city softly glimmers under the scattered clouds and fading light.
